;;意大利极右翼总理 Giorgia Meloni。
;

;意大利极右翼总理，乔治亚·梅洛尼 (Giorgia Meloni) 给德国总理奥拉夫·肖尔茨 (Olaf Scholz) 写了一封严厉的信，告诉他，她“惊讶”地得知柏林正在向地中海地区的民众提供慈善援助。

;

;意大利和德国之间的争执天主教慈善机构圣艾智德表示已与柏林签署了一项新协议，为援助意大利难民的活动提供资金，此事爆发。

;

;德国外交部发言人表示，德国政府已实施一项“财政支持计划” ” 价值 790,000 欧元（685,000 英镑），用于支持德国非政府组织 SOS Humanity 在地中海开展搜救行动。发言人补充说，拯救海上人员是一项“法律、人道主义和道德义务”。

;
;

;;相关：;;兰佩杜萨岛的危机我们独自面对的是人道主义危机，而不是移民入侵;

;
;

;在超过 11,000 人抵达南部兰佩杜萨岛后，意大利再次成为欧洲移民危机的中心一周之内，今年迄今为止登陆意大利海岸的总人数达到约 133,000 人，是 2022 年同期的两倍多。

;

;梅洛尼呼吁对非正常移民采取强硬政策，同时发誓不让意大利成为“欧洲的难民营”。

;

;在与意大利新闻机构分享的一封写给肖尔茨的信中，梅洛尼写道：“我惊讶地获悉，你们的政府——以与意大利政府不协调的方式——已经据称，决定向从事意大利境内非正常移民接收和地中海救援工作的非政府组织提供大量资金支持。”

;

;梅洛尼补充说，欧盟成员国应重点关注“结构性解决方案” ”。

;

;“例如，通过与地中海南岸的过境国合作实施一项欧盟倡议，而且，与已经实施了一段时间的倡议相比，该倡议所需的资源更少与土耳其。”

;
;

;;相关：;;欧盟与突尼斯的移民协议有何争议？;

;
;

;意大利国防部长，吉多·克罗塞托 (Guido Crosetto) 也将矛头指向德国，表示他希望在意大利应对入境人数激增的“困难时刻”获得“援助和声援”。

;

;梅洛尼政府，还承诺迅速驱逐那些被拒绝寻求庇护的人，上周签署了一项措施，赋予当局权力将人们在驱逐前拘留中心关押长达 18 个月。

;

;政府还规定等待庇护申请得到处理的人必须缴纳押金，据报道价值 5,000 欧元，以避免被拘留。

; Tue, 26 Sep 2023 02:22:02 +0800 Biden pledges $40bn to Pacific islands as summit seeks to reassert influencehttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/sep/25/biden-pacific-islands-aid-china
;;2023-09-25T18:01:20Z;
;
;;乔·拜登与库克群岛总理马克·布朗交谈，两侧是巴布亚新几内亚总理詹姆斯·马拉佩，左和基里巴斯总统塔内蒂·马毛在白宫。
;

;乔·拜登在与该地区领导人举行的白宫会议上向太平洋岛屿提供了 400 亿美元的经济援助，旨在加强美国在应对这一问题上的参与总统还在太平洋岛屿论坛开始时宣布美国正式承认库克群岛和纽埃这两个新岛国，这是华盛顿与来自两国领导人举行的为期两天的会议。该组织有 18 个成员。

;

;“美国致力于确保印太地区自由、开放、繁荣和安全。拜登在论坛欢迎仪式上表示：“我们致力于与餐桌旁的所有国家合作，以实现这一目标。”

;

;来访的领导人受到了从纽约带来的政府的招待。大多数人参加了联合国大会，乘坐专列前往巴尔的摩，在那里他们被带到巴尔的摩乌鸦队体育场观看美式橄榄球比赛。在那里，他们被带上战场，并因“在印度太平洋地区作为美国朋友的角色”而受到庆祝。

;
;

;;相关：;;拜登寻求赢得胜利太平洋领导人在所罗门群岛拒绝谈判时;

;
;

;太平洋领导人还被带到巴尔的摩港的一艘美国海岸警卫队快艇上，并听取了海岸警卫队司令海军上将的简报。琳达·费根 (Linda Fagan)，关于打击非法捕鱼和管理海域的行动。在接下来的两天里，他们将与政府高层成员会面。国务卿安东尼·布林肯和驻联合国大使琳达·托马斯-格林菲尔德将于周一晚上为来访者举办晚宴，第二天晚上，澳大利亚大使馆将举办烧烤会。

;

;一位高级政府官员表示：“我认为拜登政府能够做的是在短时间内大幅加强我们在印太地区的竞争。” “我们在这里拥有深厚的道德、战略和历史利益。我认为我们正在重申这一承诺。”

;

;然而，随着所罗门群岛的宣布，美国旨在夺回中国在该地区影响力的魅力攻势在开始之前就遭遇了挫折。 ;总理，玛纳西索加瓦雷现在与北京关系密切;，他不会出席。

;

;一位高级政府官员表示，“我认为可以公平地说，美国对索加瓦雷的决定感到失望”

;

;索加瓦雷参加完联合国大会后周末回家。他去年拒绝签署美国-太平洋伙伴关系协议，但去年与中国签署了安全协议，并同意加强执法和安全事务上的合作。

; ;

;瓦努阿图总理萨托基尔曼没有出席，因为他必须返回以面对议会不信任投票。

;

;拜登提供的部分经济基础设施援助包括与太平洋岛国的安全海底电缆连接。然而，拨款计划必须提交给国会，共和党人威胁要在支出僵局中关闭政府。

;

;除了承认库克群岛和纽埃岛外，政府还开设了两个新的项目所罗门群岛和汤加的大使馆。随着太平洋地区成为与中国战略竞争的焦点，美国国际开发署计划于明年初在斐济设立地区代表团，并在瓦努阿图设立美国大使馆，以弥补数十年来的外交忽视。

;

;预计太平洋领导人将在会谈中推动对气候变化等问题提供更多支持，并将于周一会见美国气候特使约翰·克里。

;
;

;;相关： ;;太平洋拉力：西方领导人奔赴该地区抗衡中国;

;
;

;拜登主持;一年前与 14 个太平洋岛国举行的首次峰会;他的政府承诺将与盟友和伙伴更加努力地合作，以满足他们的需求。

;

;“毫无疑问，中华人民共和国在这一切中发挥了一定作用……其自信和影响力，包括法新社援引一位不愿透露姓名的白宫高级官员的话说：“在这个地区，这一直是要求我们保持战略重点的一个因素。”

;

;梅格·基恩博士，太平洋岛屿项目主任洛伊研究所将这次峰会描述为“历史性的”，它是在拜登之后;取消今年早些时候对巴布亚新几内亚的访问;，专注于债务上限谈判。

;

;“鉴于长期以来缺席，美国一直在迅速努力收复失地，”基恩说。

;

;“他们已经重返该地区。该地区正在等待重大承诺是否能够兑现。”

;

;在 2022 年峰会期间，;美国宣布向岛国提供超过8亿美元的援助;。白宫在一份声明中表示，今年的峰会将重申美国致力于共同的区域优先事项以及在气候变化和海事安全等关键问题上进行合作。

;

;汤加总理西奥西·索瓦莱尼 (Siaosi Sovaleni) 在即将举行的会议上对记者表示这是“我们分享我们的担忧的一个机会”。

;

;上周峰会前在纽约举行的一次高级别会议上，索瓦莱尼表示汤加的首要任务是气候变化和海洋，他将寻找新的投资者来支持这些挑战。

;

;“变革的紧迫性是显而易见的，”索瓦莱尼说。

;

;索瓦莱尼预计将讨论美国如何支持更好地获得气候融资和改善海洋安全和管理。

;

;太平洋岛屿论坛秘书长亨利·普纳上周在纽约举行的一次活动中表示，他希望峰会能够就气候变化等问题采取具体行动。< /p>;

;

;普纳表示，太平洋岛国地区已经从十年前的战略忽视时期，转变为当今战略利益、竞争和“操纵”的对象——指的是该地区影响力的地缘政治竞争美国和中国之间。

; Tue, 26 Sep 2023 02:22:01 +0800 Italy culls tens of thousands of pigs to contain African swine feverhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/25/italy-african-swine-fever-asf-outbreak-lombardy-culls
;;2023-09-25T17:31:31Z;
;
;;上周，意大利北部伦巴第的一个农场进行了生猪扑杀。
;

;大量生猪扑杀上周在意大利发生了一场疫情，旨在遏制该国自 20 世纪 60 年代以来最大规模的非洲猪瘟 (ASF) 病毒爆发，该病毒威胁到整个养猪业。

;

;非洲猪瘟对猪来说是致命的，并构成威胁。据世界卫生组织称，这是对全球养猪业的严重威胁，但;对人类没有危险;世界动物卫生组织 (WOAH)。

;

;该组织表示，这种病毒：“在环境中具有很强的抵抗力……[并且]可以在衣服、靴子、车轮和其他材料上生存。”它还可以在各种猪肉产品中生存，例如火腿、香肠或培根”，这意味着“如果不采取适当的措施，人类行为可能在这种猪病跨境传播中发挥重要作用”。

;

;截至今年 5 月，已发现该病毒有 24 种不同的变种或基因型。 WOAH 表示，感染该病毒的生猪死亡率可能高达 100%。

;

;上周，意大利伦巴第大区（被称为意大利的“意大利”）爆发聚集性疫情后，扑杀了近 34,000 头生猪。 ="https://english.fleischwirtschaft.de/economy/news/african-swine-fever-concerns-over-spread-in-italys-main-pork-product-region-56131">;猪肉带;和;欧洲主要生猪产区;之一。

;

;“[在意大利国家猪瘟参考实验室负责人弗朗西斯科·费利齐亚尼 (Francesco Feliziani) 表示：“伦巴第大区是意大利最大的由基因型 II 型 ASF 病毒引起的疫情。”

;

;伦巴第大区的疫情“很快被扑灭”，但“造成了重大影响”。费利齐亚尼说，由于该地区是我国最大的生猪生产地，整个行业都受到威胁。

;

;由于没有针对非洲猪瘟的疫苗，费利齐亚尼表示，为了遏制这种疾病，必须进行扑杀。他说，根本问题“仍然是野猪种群中存在病毒”，这为病毒提供了储存库。

;

;“在欧洲，[ASF] 的威胁非常强大；费利齐亚尼补充说，非洲猪瘟正在扰乱世界各地的养猪业，但他警告说，非集约化、传统的养猪业畜牧业模式可能没有足够的生物安全水平，尤其面临风险，并可能完全消失。

;

;“这将对许多社会阶层产生强烈的经济影响，也会影响农村地区的生物多样性集约化畜牧业是不可能的，并且由于按照传统方法饲养的产品的典型性而得以生存，”他说。

;

;为了控制非洲猪瘟在中国的爆发，生产者;建设多层养猪场< /a>; 与后院牛群相比，这些动物被认为具有更高的疾病控制标准。

;

;由非政府组织 We Animals Media 拍摄的伦巴第扑杀视频片段显示了“整个过程的概述，一位发言人在电子邮件中表示，其中包括一个被改造为移动屠宰场的受感染农场，不间断地运营了一周多。

;

;“工人们从其他受感染农场接收了生猪，并将它们赶到临时屠宰场。他们说：“在容器内设置毒气室，然后杀死动物。”

;

;尽管非洲猪瘟对亚洲的野猪多样性构成“重大风险”，但意大利的情况并非如此，那里有大量野猪发言人补充道，意大利的扑杀行动虽然规模较大，但并不是欧洲迄今为止规模最大的，《a href="https://www" 的编辑文森特·特·贝克 (Vincent ter Beek) 表示.pigprogress.net/">;Pig Progress;，一直在跟踪世界各地非洲猪瘟的疫情。

;

;“几年前，罗马尼亚也出现过非洲猪瘟，”他说。 “相比之下……[意大利的扑杀]数量相对较小。我们不要谈论俄罗斯或中国的数字。我并不是想淡化任何事情，这个数量对生产者和猪来说都是可怕的，但这不是欧盟最大的。”

;

;他补充说，人类和野猪仍然是传播的最大风险这种病。 “人类可以让病毒出现在 500 公里外的野猪种群中，;就像几周前在瑞典发生的那样;，然后野猪在它们之间传播，”他说。

;

;鉴于野猪没有被追踪和追踪Ter Beek 表示，这种疾病可以向任何方向传播，但他补充说，公猪传播这种疾病“通常不会很快发生，而是一点一点传播”。

;

;Ter Beek 说 < a href="https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2021/jan/07/could-a-deadly-pig-virus-transform-germanys-fixation-on-cheap-meat">;德国似乎正在做很好地控制了非洲猪瘟;，其努力可以为处理野猪身上的病毒提供蓝图，“尽管各地的地形和野猪种群密度不同”。

;

;病毒传播的结果特贝克说，野猪中可能会出现“暂时数量大大减少的野猪”。然而，丰富的食物和相对温和的冬季意味着“数量将相当快地反弹”，而非洲猪瘟病毒“时不时地卷土重来”，使其很难从一个国家根除。

;

;专家;欧洲兽医联合会;表示：“自2017年以来，欧洲有超过230万头猪因非洲猪瘟而死亡。尽管它对人类无害，但对猪来说可能是致命的，并对受影响国家造成严重的社会经济后果。由于欧洲尚无疫苗，早期发现、预防和报告是遏制这种致命疾病的关键。我们都应该认真对待这件事。”

; Tue, 26 Sep 2023 01:52:01 +0800 Macron launches ‘ecological plan’ to end France’s use of fossil fuels by 2030https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/25/emmanuel-macron-ecological-plan-end-france-fossil-fuels-by-2030
;;2023-09-25T17:28:16Z;
;
;;伊曼纽尔·马克龙
;

;伊曼纽尔·马克龙公布了一项减少法国温室气体排放的国家“生态计划”排放量减少 55%，并到 2030 年停止使用化石燃料。

;

;法国总统在爱丽舍宫举行特别部长级会议后发表讲话，表示将额外投入 100 亿欧元（87 亿英镑）用于 50马克龙表示，该计划旨在解决气候危机，同时确保法国在农业和工业方面保持竞争力。

; <他说，“法国减少我们对所谓化石燃料、煤炭、汽油和天然气的依赖是至关重要的，我们不再生产这些燃料，但我们依赖它们”。他补充说，我们的目标是到 2030 年将这种依赖程度从 60% 降低到 40%。

;

;“我们设定的优先事项是，到 2027 年 1 月，我们将完全停止对煤炭的使用。电力生产，”他说。

;
;

;;相关：;;透露：欧洲几乎每个人都在呼吸有毒空气;

;
;

;该计划中的其他措施包括加速电动汽车的生产，对燃气锅炉的限制，尽管总统没有全面禁止。它还包括海上风电场的新项目、在法国北部开设几家电池工厂、确定法国自然资源的位置的地图，包括氢气和锂电池的基本元素，以及 7 亿欧元的国家投资区域火车网络。

;

;负责法国 50 个最肮脏工业场所的公司将签署一项协议，在 2030 年前将污染减少 45%。

;

;马克龙表示，国家将下个月收回电价控制权。他表示，将鼓励人们考虑热泵等替代方案，并承诺在未来三年内将泵产量增加三倍，并培训 30,000 名新安装人员。

;

;虽然马克龙宣布了该计划，但法国能源部办公室去年任命了生态规划秘书长后，总理伊丽莎白·博恩起草了这份草案。 Antoine Pellion 的任务是“协调 ;气候、能源、生物多样性和循环经济领域的国家战略;”。

;

;博恩上周向党领导人和生态团体介绍了该计划，其中几项内容形容它令人失望。 “这个生态规划是历史上最长的沟通计划，”来自欧洲生态学 les Verts 的 Marine Tondelier 在会见总理后说道。

;

;社会党领袖奥利维尔·福雷 (Olivier Faure) 表示，该计划“令人失望” ”。

;;七月，洛杉矶卡尔弗城亚马逊工作室园区外的引人注目的作家。
;

; ;好莱坞与工作室高管受到了罢工者和业内其他人士的好评。

;Six months after ;Bruce Willis; was diagnosed with frontotemporal dementia, it is “hard to know” whether the actor, known for roles in Die Hard and Pulp Fiction, is aware of the extent to which his condition has worsened, his wife has revealed in a new interview.

;

;Emma Heming Willis also ;told; Today's Hoda Kotb in an interview broadcast on Monday that she has been a “care partner” to her husband since the moment of the diagnosis.

;

;She ;described; the 68-year-old actor as the “gift that keeps on giving” who has taught his family “love, patience and resilience” in the midst of their grief.

;

;Heming Willis spoke as she continues to advocate for people living with the condition known as FTD, whose symptoms include emotional problems, trouble communicating, struggles with walking and difficulty working, according to the ;National Institute on Aging;.

;

;Bruce Willis first stepped away from acting in March of last year after his family publicly revealed he was dealing with aphasia, a neurological condition that impairs people's language processing, including their ability to read and write. Earlier this year, in February, Willis's ;family; announced that his condition had evolved into FTD.

;

;Since then, coming to terms with her husband's condition has been a “blessing and a curse” for Heming Willis, she told Kotb in Monday's interview.

;

;Frontotemporal dementia can often be misdiagnosed, and “to finally understand what was happening so that I could be into the acceptance of what is – it doesn't make it any less painful, but … just being in the know of what is happening to Bruce makes it a little easier,” Heming Willis said.

;

;FTD differs from Alzheimer's in that it affects a different area of the brain. Susan Dickenson, the chief executive officer of the Association for Frontotemporal Degeneration, said on Today that the disorder can manifest in “unexplained changes in how a person is in the world”.

;

;Dickenson added: “Somebody who normally speaks absolutely fine has trouble putting their thoughts into meaningful sentences, or they may lose the meaning of a specific word.”

;

;Heming Willis spoke to Kotb at the start of World Frontotemporal Dementia Awareness Week. She and her husband married in 2009 and have two daughters together.

;

;

;Thousands of passengers flying to and from Gatwick this week will have their flights cancelled after the airport announced a cap on movements because of a shortage of staff in air traffic control.

;

;Gatwick imposed an immediate cap on Monday of 800 flights taking off or landing a day.

;

;The airport said it would share the total of 164 cancellations proportionately between airlines until Sunday, with easyJet passengers most likely to be affected given the carrier operates just under half of all Gatwick flights.

;

;People travelling on Friday are most likely to be hit, with 865 flights scheduled to depart. The airport and airlines are expected to announce cuts on Tuesday.

;

;Gatwick said the move was to reduce on-the-day cancellations and chaos and allow more passengers to be rebooked in advance. Short-notice staff absences in the air traffic control team have resulted in ;dozens of flights being cancelled, delayed or rerouted in recent weeks;.

;

;The West Sussex airport was forced to apologise to thousands of travellers whose plans were thrown into chaos after more than 40 flights were affected by staff absences.

;

;About 30% of those at Gatwick working for Nats, which is contracted to provide air traffic control services at the airport, are understood to be sick or unable to perform full duties.

;

;Stewart Wingate, Gatwick's chief executive, said he had received repeated assurances from Nats after temporary air traffic control restrictions were put in place at the airport earlier this month, but the situation was not improving.

;

;He said it was “a difficult decision to take” but Gatwick was “trying to give that certainty” to airlines and passengers.

;

;After the disruption earlier this month the outspoken Ryanair chief executive, Michael O'Leary, called on Martin Rolfe, the boss of Nats, to resign over a “blatant failure to adequately staff UK air traffic control”.

;

;Wingate did not echo that demand but called on Rolfe to “put maximum effort into keeping this disruption to a minimum and to redouble their efforts to have more resilience in our tower”.

;

;He added: “They must deliver on the commitment that they made to us when we gave them the contract – not only for our own good but for the good of the airlines, and most importantly for passengers.”

;

;Last summer, Heathrow airport ;introduced a daily limit of 100,000 passengers; as it struggled to cope with the post-pandemic increase in travel, with travellers facing long queue times amid shortages of ground staff, and airlines cancelling thousands of flights.

;

;The airport kept the daily limit in place ;from July until the end of October; as it sought to hire and train tens of thousands of staff.

;A Spanish prosecutor's office has said it will investigate whether AI-generated images of naked teenage girls, allegedly created and shared by their peers in south-western Spain, constituted a crime.

;

;The rise in use by children of such technologies has sparked widespread concern among parents worldwide. The FBI warned in June that criminals were ;increasingly using artificial intelligence; to create sexually explicit images to intimidate and extort victims.

;

;The prosecutor received a 200-page police dossier with about 20 complaints by families denouncing that fake nude pictures of their daughters generated with an AI app were circulating on social media and chatrooms used by teenagers in Almendralejo, a town of 30,000 people in the Extremadura region.

;

;In Madrid, a court is investigating a similar case involving naked pictures of two young victims they claim were generated by AI, police said.

;

;In Extremadura, teenagers aged between 13 and 15 have been identified as being responsible for generating and sharing the images, according to the police report.

;

;The prosecutor's office said it would analyse the documents before deciding if those older than 14 can be investigated and eventually charged with a crime.

;

;Under Spanish law minors under 14 cannot be charged but their cases are sent to child protection services, which can force them to take part in rehabilitation courses.

;

;The mother of one of the victims said the dissemination of fake pictures on WhatsApp had been going on since July.

;

;“Many girls were completely terrified and had tremendous anxiety attacks because they were suffering this in silence. They felt bad and were afraid to tell and be blamed for it,” she told Reuters.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Too much too young: I talked to 10,000 children about pornography. Here are 10 things I learned;

;
;

;She said the debate should be included in the national political agenda, as it combined issues such as bullying, sexual violence, hypersexualisation of children, objectification of women and ;ease of access to pornography at a young age.;

;

;Fernando Miró-Llinares, a professor of criminal law at Miguel Hernández University and an AI adviser to the Council of Europe, told Reuters any criminal liability in this case would depend on the age of the perpetrators.

;

;If older than 14, they could face charges related to creating images of child abuse and perhaps also crimes against personal honour, image or moral integrity, he added.

; Tue, 26 Sep 2023 00:52:01 +0800 ‘In total shock’: birdwatchers amazed as ‘uber-rare’ American birds land in UKhttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/sep/25/canada-warbler-magnolia-uber-rare-american-birds-land-in-uk-aoe
;;2023-09-25T16:00:30Z;
;
;;A small bird with yellow belly and brown back sits among foliage
;

;A record-breaking number of “uber-rare” North American songbirds have arrived in the UK this week, blown over the Atlantic in the aftermath of Hurricane Lee.

;

;More than a dozen species of small songbirds – one of which has never been seen in the UK before – were sent veering off their usual migration routes by the high winds.

;

;It was “the largest such arrival ever recorded in the British Isles”, said Dr Alexander Lees, a reader at Manchester Metropolitan University and the chair of the British Ornithologists' Union Records Committee. “One species hasn't been seen before, and several have only been recorded once or twice.”

;

;Their presence has delighted British birdwatchers, who gathered in their hundreds to spot the avian arrivals. “这就像让你的足球队赢得英超联赛一样，”对观鸟特别感兴趣的生态学家索菲·巴雷尔说，她成功地看到了所有三种最稀有的物种。她说：“如此漫长的旅程真是令人难以置信的壮举，因为他们已经走了好几英里。 To have multiple birds come over, and survive in this way, has just never happened for in my lifetime.”

; ;

;The British birding website ;Rare Bird Alert; described the “spew of uber-rare land birds” as “one of the most memorable couple of days in British and Irish birding history”.

;

;So far, 15 species have been spotted, with 49 individual birds.其中包括加拿大莺，这种鸟以前在英国从未见过。与此同时，湾胸莺在英国出现了第二次，木兰莺则是第三次。 All were spotted in Pembrokeshire, which got the lion's share of activity.

;

;The Chester-based birder Toby Phelps, who was the first to spot the Canada warbler and magnolia warber, ;posted on X;: “I am still in total shock from last week, these are by far the most incredible experiences I have ever had birding.”

;

;The birds' arrival was “a bittersweet phenomenon”, Lees said. “Incredibly exciting for birders … but sad knowing that these are the fortunate few as most of the migrants displaced by the storms will have drowned at sea.”

;
;

;;Related: ;;The crowd goes wild: FC Barcelona reveals Camp Nou stadium's animal inhabitants;

;
; ;

;Strong, early, autumn storms make birds more likely to come over, ;research has suggested;. “Climate models indicate that the frequency of severe storms in the Atlantic will increase as temperatures rise and this may have significant negative impacts on North American bird populations,” Lees said.

;

;It is unlikely these songbirds will be able to fly back across the Atlantic. If they find sufficient food in the UK, it is possible they will continue their migration south, and try to find somewhere warmer to overwinter. Most of them, however, are unlikely to survive.

;

;The last time such a glut of American songbirds were blown over was more than 30 years ago, when bird populations were far larger – but this past week has seen a greater number of birds arrive.
